title: Real-Time Research in the USDA
abstract: DigiTop is the USDA's Digital Desktop Library. It serves as a gateway to quality information resources, many not available through the "ordinary" Web. DigiTop supplies authoritative and reliable published information about agriculture, forestry and allied fields, including government, economics and business, by providing around-the-clock access to key databases, journals, newspapers, statistics, and other important electronic resources that are licensed on behalf of USDA employees. DigiTop uses MarkLogic to provide an enriched searchable content base derived from over 60 million records. In addition, DigiTop’s MarkLogic implementation provides management of “favorites,” content exporting, and highly customizable alerts functionality. The enriched content base makes the DigiTop a one of a kind resource for USDA employees and researchers.

speakers.affiliation: National Agriculture Library U.S. Department of Agriculture
speakers.name: Stan Kosecki
speakers.title: Head Information Services and Collections Branch

surveys.comments: I worked on this project when I was in Professional Services. Interesting to see where it's gone since.
Inspired lots of good questions, though Matthew seemed a little nervous during the presentation
Speakers where difficult to understand.  Appeared to have a very functional implementation.
